title: Tahm needs counterplay.
body:
A) he cant eat an ally if that ally is CCed. he is pretty much a walking {{item:3140}}  for his teammates.

B) you should be able to knock someone out of his stomach if you deal enough damage in time OR if you hit tahm with hard CC. how its done doesnt matter, what matter is that someone should be able to save an ally from kench stomach or knock out an enemy from his stomach.

C) him being able to flash while his own ally is in his stomach is too much, however this can s tay if B is taken into consideration and a target can be knocked out of his stomach

Well, a couple of those proposals you suggested are pretty nuanced, and I'm not sure they'd do the trick. 

My problem with Tahm isn't that he saves his allies very well, it's that he disables enemies way too hard and often.

I'd suggest the following:
1.) After stunning a target with Tongue Lash, their stacks of An Acquired Taste are reset
2.) After Tahm spits out an enemy champion, that champion has a debuff (maybe called Unsavory or something?)for 4-ish seconds. This debuff prevents stacks of An Acquired Taste from being applied, and makes Tongue Lash's slow decay over the duration. 

It's punishing enough to be caught by Tahm's Devour, but to be perpetually in his grasps is unfair. I think my proposed changes would give Tahm's enemies some breathing room after he's caught them.

I can see where you're going with that first suggestion, but that would hurt his kit waaay too much. Usually you have to use the stun to be able to catch up and eat someone after you got the stacks on them, but having to reapply the stacks again? That's hitting someone 6 times before you can eat them.  And if he decides not to use his Q for the stun when chasing someone to eat them, then that just adds a penalty to him for getting max stacks on someone because it discourages him from using his only ranged ability.

I like your 2nd idea though.

I think his first point is actually quite good, as Tahm, you shouldn't use the stun to eat the enemy, that lacks counterplay since the stun is so easy to land, you should instead use the slow (it's more than strong enough) to apply the 2nd stack and the hit and devour, that would have soem counterplay since the devour is a point and click skill. The problem with Tahm is that his kit is just an unstoppable chain, unliky other champs with similiarly empowered skills, he doesn't need to choose between which one he wants to use, he can just use both of them. If he would have to get either the stun or the devour, he would be way more balanced and fair.

That said, you are correct too in that during the stun, you won't be able to apply again the 3 stacks before the enemy can escape, you usually will have the time to hit him twice then he would bea able to get out of range if he's good and, while later in the game you would have q off cd or maybe be able to stack him thanks to the bonus AS, early game it might be a bit frustrating to see an enemy escape with 3 stacks, but that would still be unable to justify the ability to chain stun + devour, since that doesn't have any counterplay and qss isn't an acceptable counterplay by itself (like for any champion that's countered by it).

Exactly, being unable to apply the 3 stacks again most of the time is why I think consuming them would be a bit too heavy of a nerf.  They could probably justify that by increasing the stun duration or his base AS or something, but I just feel like there are other areas of his kit that would be better to hit.  I saw one suggestion by a Rioter (can't remember who) that said maybe just make it so that he doesn't get the shield on his E until the end of the animation.  Or maybe actually reduce his tongue's hitbox, it feels way too easy to land sometimes.

Or maybe I could see the stack consuming be justified if it didn't consume ALL of them, maybe only took away 1 or 2.

Well, the problem actually comes when he can Q you twice early both slowing you and stunning you, making you unable to escape, this way, he can't chain a slow and then a stun into his devour since he wouldn't be able to devour you, he shouln' be able to acces devour this easily early game, he should use his q as a slow to reach you and AA you since Q has a tremendous slow that doesn't decay. His amin problem thogh is that he can max Q without losing anything, so he gets that tremendous power too early, getting effectively 2 power spikes (One with max rank Q and the other with R), opposed to other champs who usually either get 1 or get 2 weaker ones (like Renekton, he hits a power spike at level 3 because he can take all 3 skills when other champs usually get 2 by that point, and then he gets a weaker one with his ult and starts to fall off unless ahead).

If you read the article about {{champion:223}}'s inception and what inspired him, you'll find that his entire character is based around his W. Everything from his appearance and lore to his kit revolves around it. Dramatically nerfing his key ability will make him practically unviable. If you want counter play then you need to bait out his W or buy {{item:3123}} to negate his healing. Or your supp can have a silence ({{champion:53}} and {{champion:16}}) or a stun ({{champion:37}}, {{champion:89}}, {{champion:412}}). AOE dmg ({{champion:32}}'s despair, {{champion:9}}'s ult, {{item:3068}}) also makes using his W on you backfire

Refusing to nerf an ability just because it is the "core" ability of a champion can be dangerous.

Look at {{champion:38}}. Riot refused to nerf his ult for a long time because they said it was his core ability, and everything from his appearance and lore revolved around it.

Then they nerfed the rest of his kit so much, just to allow his ult to continue to be strong. Until they realized that there was no other possible solution, and Kassadin would always be strong no matter how much they nerfed the rest of his kit, due to his ult. Then they decided to finally nerf it. But when they did that, the rest of his kit has already been butchered. And what was left was a Kassadin that was only a shadow of the shadow of his former self.

As much as Tahm Kench is strong, I would wish Riot didn't do the same thing to him that they did to Kassadin.
